data.title: Programmes and courses
data.text:
Welcome To Jagiroad College

The College offers the following Programmes and courses in regular modes

The College offers the following Programmes and courses in regular modes:

Higher Secondary Courses (Duration: 2 years, affiliated to AHSEC):

Higher Secondary Course (10+2) in Arts

Higher Secondary Course (10+2) in Science

Undergraduate Programmes (Duration: 3 years, semester mode, affiliated to G.U.):

Bachelor of Arts

Bachelor of Science

Bachelor of Commerce

Bachelor of Vocation (B. Voc.)

Post Graduate (Self-financing) Programmes ( Affiliated to Gauhati University):

Post Graduate Diploma in Computer Applications (PGDCA) : Duration: 1 year

Master in Tourism Management (MTM) : Duration: 2 years

Career Oriented Programmes:

One Year Advance Diploma in Construction Works (ADCW) as add-on courses. (UGC approved and granted) Following courses are newly added and being offered with the certification from National Institute of Electronics & Information Technology (NIELIT), (erstwhile DOEACC Society), an Autonomous Scientific Society under the administrative control of Department of Electronics & Information Technology (DeitY), Ministry of Communications and Information Technology, Government of India.

Certificate course in Office Automation

Certificate course in Soft skill development and Communicative English

Vocational Subjects ( Undergraduate level):

Computer Applications

Tourism and Travel Management

Bachelor of Vocation Course (B. Voc.):

Under the guidance of National Skill Qualification Framework (NSQF), the following skill generating and employment centric courses are being offered under the recently introduced B. Voc. scheme of UGC. The courses are funded by UGC and approved by Gauhati University.

Retail Management

Acting

*Details are included in the B. Voc. Section.

Courses under Community College scheme of UGC:

Since January 2015, the College has been offering the following skilled based, industry collaborated and employment centric courses under the UGC funded Community College scheme. Both the courses are of two years (four semester) duration with the option of multiple exit/entry.

Pulp and Paper Technology(PPT).

Fashion Technology (FT).

* Details are included in the Community College Section.

Distance Education Programmes and Courses:

IGNOU (A wide range of Programmes and courses are offered through the approved Study Centre located within the College campus.)

Institute of Distance and Open Learning (IDOL) of the Gauhati University. (A wide range of Master Degree Programmes and courses are offered through the approved Study Centre located within the College campus.)

A study cum exam center of Krishna KantaHandiqui State Open University (KKHSOU) was also started from the academic session 2014-15.

Important:

Higher Secondary Programme at Jagiroad College is conducted under the guidelines and rules framed by the Assam Higher Secondary Council(AHSEC)—which is one of the Board of Senior Secondary Education recognised by the Central Board of Education(CBSE).

Three Year Degree (Semester) Programme in Arts, Science and Commerce are conducted under the rules and regulations of the Gauhati University, Guwahati. These Programmes are recognized under Section 22 of the UGC Act 1956.

The Master in Tourism Management (MTM) and PGDCA Programmes have also been approved by the Gauhati University.

The vocational course in Computer Science is approved by the Assam Higher Secondary Education Council. The vocational courses of Computer Applications and Tourism and Travel Management have similarly been approved by the Academic Council of the Gauhati University.

The Programmes transmitted through distance education mode by the IDOL, KKHSOU and the IGNOU are approved by Universities and they are run under the strict guidelines and rules of the Universities.

The term “Programme” is used here in consonance with the ongoing process of reforms and changing paradigms of Higher Education in India. It generally refers to the earlier concept of a “Course”. A “Course” conveys the title and components of compulsory and optional papers under a “Programme.” We have used the term in a flexible way which while retaining the gamut of meaning of earlier terminology simultaneously covers the ambit of the Subject and its components. This has been done so that the use of the term “Programme” does not create confusion among parents, guardians and students who are accustomed with the earlier notion of a “Course.”
